PARAGRAPH.STRING: (French: rivière Athabasca) originates from the Athabasca Glacier of the Columbia Icefield in Jasper National Park in Alberta, Canada. The impressive and scenic Athabasca Falls is located upstream about 30 km from the Jasper townsite.
